definition: see 好了傷疤忘了疼|好了伤疤忘了疼[hao3 le5 shang1 ba1 wang4 le5 teng2]
pinyin: hao3 le5 chuang1 ba1 wang4 le5 tong4

sentences.english: The journalists like to dish the dirt about television stars.
sentences.chinese: 记者有时喜欢揭电视明星的疮疤。

sentences.english: Itchy nose waist sour, rain in a long time.
sentences.chinese: 腰酸疮疤痒，有雨在半晌。

sentences.english: No man will admit his sores.
sentences.chinese: 没有人会承认自己有溃烂的疮疤。

sentences.english: Don'trub my nose in it in front of my friends.
sentences.chinese: 不要在我朋友面前揭我的疮疤。

sentences.english: Depending on its severity, acne can cause emotional distress and lead to scarring of the skin.
sentences.chinese: 根据严重程度，痤疮可造成痛苦情绪并导致皮肤疮疤。

sentences.english: This scar is her main distinguishing mark.
sentences.chinese: 这块疮疤是她主要的识别记号。

sentences.english: Has already apologized for his wrong doing , we don't have to rub his nose in it.
sentences.chinese: 先生已经为他的错误道歉，我们不必再揭他的疮疤。

sentences.english: The cut will not leave any scar.
But, who can clearly see the scars on his face and what he is struggling from?
sentences.chinese: 可又有谁能清楚地看到他脸上的疮疤和背后的创伤呢？

sentences.english: Fly-in ads are derivatives of pop-ups which are also equally irking to the visitors.
sentences.chinese: 飞在疮疤衍生流行起坐也是同样触怒了参观者。

sentences.english: Don't rub my nose in it in front of my friends.
sentences.chinese: 不要在我朋友面前揭我的疮疤。

definition: to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
to puncture/to pierce/(fig.) to destroy (the facade concealing an unpleasant reality)
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight/also written 觸目驚心|触目惊心
to pretend that everything is going well
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
